shortDescription.text: GMS-2022-1062: OWASP Top Ten 2017 Category A9 - Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

help.text:
zend-diactoros (and, by extension, Expressive), zend-http (and, by extension, Zend Framework MVC projects), and zend-feed (specifically, its PubSubHubbub sub-component) each contain a potential URL rewrite exploit. In each case, marshaling a request URI includes logic that introspects HTTP request headers that are specific to a given server-side URL rewrite mechanism.

When these headers are present on systems not running the specific URL rewriting mechanism, the logic would still trigger, allowing a malicious client or proxy to emulate the headers to request arbitrary content.
help.markdown:
> zend-diactoros (and, by extension, Expressive), zend-http (and, by extension, Zend Framework MVC projects), and zend-feed (specifically, its PubSubHubbub sub-component) each contain a potential URL rewrite exploit. In each case, marshaling a request URI includes logic that introspects HTTP request headers that are specific to a given server-side URL rewrite mechanism.

When these headers are present on systems not running the specific URL rewriting mechanism, the logic would still trigger, allowing a malicious client or proxy to emulate the headers to request arbitrary content.

|                |                                                 |
|----------------|-------------------------------------------------|
| Package        | pkg:composer/zendframework/zend-diactoros@1.8.2 |
| Affected range | <1.8.4                                          |
| Fixed version  | 1.8.4                                           |

shortDescription.text: CVE-2021-32850: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

help.text: jQuery MiniColors is a color picker built on jQuery. Prior to version 2.3.6, jQuery MiniColors is prone to cross-site scripting when handling untrusted color names. This issue is patched in version 2.3.6.
help.markdown:
> jQuery MiniColors is a color picker built on jQuery. Prior to version 2.3.6, jQuery MiniColors is prone to cross-site scripting when handling untrusted color names. This issue is patched in version 2.3.6.

|                |                                                     |
|----------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| Package        | pkg:npm/%!c(MISSING)laviska/jquery-minicolors@2.2.6 |
| Affected range | <2.3.6                                              |
| Fixed version  | 2.3.6                                               |
| CVSS Score     |                                                 6.1 |
| CVSS Vector    | CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N        |

help.text: An issue was discovered in function _libssh2_packet_add in libssh2 1.10.0 allows attackers to access out of bounds memory.
help.markdown:
> An issue was discovered in function _libssh2_packet_add in libssh2 1.10.0 allows attackers to access out of bounds memory.

|                |                                                                                 |
|----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Package        | pkg:deb/ubuntu/libssh2@1.8.0-1?os_distro=bionic&os_name=ubuntu&os_version=18.04 |
| Affected range | <1.8.0-1ubuntu0.1                                                               |
| Fixed version  | 1.8.0-1ubuntu0.1                                                                |
| CVSS Score     |                                                                             7.5 |
| CVSS Vector    | CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H                                    |
